DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the clinical improvement by partial seizures reduction, safety and tolerability of subjects having partial epilepsy related to the adjunction of pregabalin BID (75 to 300mg day titration, BID) to existing standard AED (Antiepileptic drugs).
DOC.brief_title: Pregabalin In Partial Seizures (PREPS): An Open-Label, Multicenter Add On Therapy Trial
DOC.detailed_description: This study was terminated on 17 March 2009 due to delayed enrollment. The decision to terminate the trial was not based on any safety concerns, but rather on timelines and the difficulty in enrolling patients in this open label, single group study.
DOC.criteria: Male or Female who are diagnosed of partial seizure (simple partial, complex partial, partial seizure secondarily generalized) as defined in the international league of epilepsy classification of seizure. Patients having a treatable cause of seizure, currently receiving vigabatrin, having a progressive neurological or systemic disorder.
